cluster_relations.rel_desc: The interests of different cultures shape how tales evolve.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: The subject exerts a shaping influence on how the object develops or changes over time.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Psychological and Cultural Constructs of Urban Legends

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: to suit the interests of different cultures

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The fears of different cultures shape the evolution of tales.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: The subject exerts a shaping influence on how the object develops or changes over time.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Societal Fears and Anxieties in Legends

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: to suit the fears of different cultures

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The tales captivate or engage audiences.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: The subject (a story form or folklore domain) captures the attention or interest of the audience.
cluster_relations.subject_entity_name: tales of the supernatural and the unknown
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Story and Legend Audiences (including Cautionary Narratives)

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: MediumOfEngagement: tales act as medium through which audiences are captivated

remarks: Urban legends themselves are the primary subject, but tales are treated as proxy to capture engagement relation.
Urban legends themselves are the primary subject, but tales are treated as proxy to capture engagement relation.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: As an aspect of modern folklore, these stories draw interest from audiences.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: The subject (a story form or folklore domain) captures the attention or interest of the audience.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Story and Legend Audiences (including Cautionary Narratives)

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Attribution: effect primarily attributed to urban legends as an aspect of modern folklore

remarks: Relation generalized from urban legends to modern folklore; semantics slightly extrapolated.
Relation generalized from urban legends to modern folklore; semantics slightly extrapolated.

args.justification: These relations describe how tales or modern folklore capture and hold the attention of audiences, which is better modeled as an audience-content interaction rather than a direct causal mechanism. The existing canonical_rel_name and rel_cls are appropriate; only the broad class group should be adjusted from CAUSALITY to INTERACTION.
args.remark: Reclassified as INTERACTION to emphasize bidirectional engagement dynamics between narratives and audiences rather than a one-way causal influence.

executed_decisions.justification: These relations describe how tales or modern folklore capture and hold the attention of audiences, which is better modeled as an audience-content interaction rather than a direct causal mechanism. The existing canonical_rel_name and rel_cls are appropriate; only the broad class group should be adjusted from CAUSALITY to INTERACTION.
executed_decisions.remark: Reclassified as INTERACTION to emphasize bidirectional engagement dynamics between narratives and audiences rather than a one-way causal influence.
